chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth C Fanning Stanford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Each count is concurrent with each other, with conditions also Concurrent

miscConds.notes:
Undergo any assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Follow-through with any other treatment or programs recommended by the PO and comply with treatment recommended, including AODA assessment

Mandatory Court costs/fees are REMITTED by the Court

Pay DOC Supervision fees - to be paid directly to the Dept of Corrections

Credit for 7 days if probation is ever revoked
.

Motion & Order for Consolidation filed - signed by GLD
Statement of Negotiated Plea filed - signed by def
Plea Quest & Waiver filed - signed by def
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
Cts 1 & 2 - Def pleads GUILTY
CRT finds def's plea is FV&I made - factual basis exists to accept plea - finds def guilty
Remaining Cts are dismissed & read-in
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 2 yrs on each count concurrent w/ conditions also concurrent:  Follow-thru w/ any treatment / programs PO deems approp, including AODA, & follow-thru w/ any trmt recommended;  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed approp by the PO and follow-thru w/ any trmt recommended;  CRT costs/fees are REMITTED by the CRT;  Pay DOC Supervision fees - to be paid to DOC;  Credit for 2 days if probation is ever revoked;  The CRT will amend the JOC for any stipulation the parties come to as to sentence credit in the future
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
